Summary: TO 16/2. Dry with strong E or SE winds decreasing. Patchy snow cover will be firm and stable. Low Hazard.
SnowDistribution: Sparse snow cover mostly bare ground. Good visibility.  Winds approx 10mph to 20mph.
Comment: Continuing to feel cold in higher wind exposed areas. Some paths at higher elevations remain icy in places.
WeatherInfluences: It will be dry and cloudy throughout the period. Strong Easterly or South-Easterly winds will steadily decrease through the day becoming fresh to moderate. The overnight freezing level will be around 400 metres, rising to around 600 metres during the day.
SnowStability: The patchy snow cover will remain firm and stable in all locations. Greatest snow cover will be mostly in mountain areas inland from the coastal ranges and on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 750 metres. Snow will be mainly confined to coire rims, ridge flanks and gullies. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A dry and bright day, sunny at times, cloudier in the afternoon. Light to moderate East-South-Easterly winds. The freezing level was around 600 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: The patchy snow cover is firm and stable in all locations. Greatest snow cover is mostly in mountain areas inland from the coastal ranges and on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 750 metres. Snow is mainly confined to coire rims, ridge flanks and gullies. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: NC for 16.2: Unstable windslab on W, NW,N, NE aspects above 900m, isolated on steep banks below. Fragile cornices. Moderate Hazard.
SnowDistribution: Areas of firm snow - ice on many aspects, deep drifts developing in lee areas, sections of paths icy, some terrain scoured.  Cloudy above 1000 metres for most of the day, bright spells below. Winds 20-30 mph.
Comment: Very firm snow ice with serious run out potential on steep slopes. Only a trace of new snow expected over the next 24 hours.
WeatherInfluences: Fresh South-East winds will increase strong to gale force during the day and become South-South-Easterly in direction. Very little precipitation expected apart from a trace of snow during the morning.  The freezing level will be around 600 metres.
SnowStability: Unstable windslab will continue to develop on West through North to North-East aspects above 900 metres. Areas affected will be steep locations such as gullies, crag aprons and corrie rims. Below 900 metres and above 700 metres, these accumulations will be more isolated, affecting steep banks and burn lines. Fragile cornices will overhang some of these aspects. Elsewhere the snowpack will be firm and stable. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Snowfall during the early morning cleared to leave a dry day. Drifting snow on fresh South-Easterly winds. The freezing level was around 700 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Accumulations of unstable windslab continue to develop on West to North aspects above 900 metres, older windslab instabilities remain on North-East aspects. The greatest instability is within steep and convex wind sheltered locations such as corrie rims, gullies and crag aprons. Fragile cornices overhang some of these aspects.  Elsewhere the old snowpack is firm and stable and plateau areas mostly scoured.  The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

Summary: Low hazard. Localised instability. New weak windslab possible on W to N aspects above 950m.
SnowDistribution: Breakable crust in places.  Cloud base was at 700 metres all day.  Winds 20-30 mph progress difficult at times with stronger gusts
Comment: Localised new weak windslab problem on W to N aspects but tending to confined to gully exits and coire rims.
WeatherInfluences: No precipitation is forecast. Remaining cold. Moderate to strong East-South-East later South-East winds.
SnowStability: Good stability in most locations. Redistribution of snow may add new weak windslab on to steep West to North aspects above 950 metres, though this is expected to be confined to coire rims and gully exits. Minor pre-existing cold induced instabilities will remain on selected steep North to East aspects above 1000 metres.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Cold with light overnight snow showers which extended into the morning. Light to moderate East-South-East winds throughout.
ObservedSnowStability: Stability is good in most locations. Some localised near surface instabilities persist in older snow mainly on North to East aspects above 1000 metres. Also, new thin weakly bonded windslab on steep West to North aspects above 950 metres: Build up here not yet extensive and confined to coire rims and gully tops. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: LO for 16/2. Some shallow and isolated deposits of windslab on mainly W to N aspects above 900m. Otherwise generally stable. Low haz
SnowDistribution: Dusting of fresh snow, some icy paths and hillsides. Moderate visibility, improving through the day.  Winds 20 -30 mph.
Comment: Looks like a return to milder conditions next week.
WeatherInfluences: A cloudy but dry day with near gale South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will be around 600 metres.
SnowStability: Little change is expected in the snowpack. Some unstable but shallow, isolated and generally avoidable deposits of windslab will remain on mainly West to North aspects above 900 metres. Otherwise the snowpack will be shallow and generally stable. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: After some light overnight snow at all levels it was a generally dry but cloudy day. Winds were from the South-East. The freezing level rose to around 700 metres through the day.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack is generally shallow and well bonded. Some localised deposits of windslab had formed overnight and were present on West through to North aspects above 900 metres. However, these tended to be isolated, shallow and  avoidable. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: SC 16/02/25 Moderately bonded windslab in steeper wind sheltered locations on W to N aspects above 900m. Cornices! Av Haz Moderate.
SnowDistribution: Icy paths and hillsides. No visibility throughout the day above 600 metres. Winds approx 20-25mph - Chilly!
Comment: Water-ice on many paths, snow-ice in places on hillsides.
WeatherInfluences: A trace of snow overnight above 500 metres with some light to moderate snowfall during the day. Strong Easterly winds overnight, veering South-South-Easterly during the afternoon. Freezing level around 600 metres.
SnowStability: Windslab will continue to develop in wind sheltered locations on West to North aspects above 900 metres. Sharply defined corrie rims, gully tops and steep burn lines will be most affected. Fragile cornices will continue to develop. Most areas will continue to hold shallow snow or well bonded snow-ice.  The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A cold day with fresh Easterly winds. A trace of new snow above 600 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Moderately bonded windslab is present in steeper, wind sheltered locations on West to North aspects above 900 metres with localised pockets on some North-East aspects. Elsewhere the snow is either very shallow or well frozen stable old snow. Some small cornices present above these aspects. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

Summary: GC for 16/2/25. Snowpack stability will remain good. Greatest accumulations will remain on N-E aspects above 800m. Low hazard.
SnowDistribution: Firm snow and crusts - ice on many paths. Poor visibility in low cloud. Winds around 20 mph on the summits.
Comment: Staying cold on Sunday and Monday before temperatures rise during the week.
WeatherInfluences: It will remain dry with strong East-South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will be around 700 metres.
SnowStability: Snowpack stability will remain good. Greatest accumulations will remain on North to East aspects above 800 metres. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It was a dry day with moderate South-Easterly winds. The freezing level rose to around 600 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Snowpack stability is generally good. The few, isolated, shallow deposits of windslab that persist on high North to East aspects are well bonded. A breakable crust exists in many locations, with the snow surface firm and icy in other locations. The avalanche hazard is Low.
